messages: a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:11): Anyone know how to do a "translate" to objects on a canvas created with fabric.js? https://github.com/kangax/fabric.js/tree/ | https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Canvas_tutorial/Transformations#Translating

a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:12): Anyone know how to do a "translate" to objects on a canvas created with fabric.js? https://github.com/kangax/fabric.js/tree/ | https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Canvas_tutorial/Transformations#Translating
a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:12): woops. sorry about that
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:12): can you explain what youre trying to do?

a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:13): I'm trying to move things like circles and rects created with fabric.js on a canvas element by x pixels to the right and y pixels down, example: ctx.translate(480/2, 640/2);
a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:15): I don't see anything about translateing in fabric.js docs
a27133959edd9dc2db5bd0aadf7a4fb7 (22:15): *translating
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (22:15): ask kangax
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:16): but from a cursory look at the source it seems like all objects have a left and top property, which is used in the render function
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:16): so you could also just try adding to those and see if it works
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:17): I dont know if he does any tricks with only rendering changing parts of the canvas though, which probably wouldnt be triggered by doing that
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:19): er, I take that back
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:20): paths dont have that
8b62118a2c429f059f6a711c3d721504 (22:23): there are references to canvas transforms all over the place, but I dont know how he walks the scengraph, so...I'm no help
